subject: Critical Thinking
title: The Ship of Theseus: Identity and Moral Responsibility Over Time
description: A 60-second lesson on The Ship of Theseus: Identity and Moral Responsibility Over Time.

hook.text: If you replace every plank of a ship, is it still the same ship?

discovery.text: If you're not the same person: should you be punished for crimes committed by your 'earlier self'?

buildup.text: The Ship of Theseus: a paradox about identity. If every component changes gradually, does the identity persist?

twist.text: Derek Parfit argued personal identity is an illusion â€“ what matters is psychological continuity.

climax.text: This matters for ethics: criminal punishment, long-term promises, & national responsibility all assume persistent.

punchline.text: You're not the person you were 10 years ago.

quiz.question: Why is the Ship of Theseus relevant to ethics?
options: It raises questions about whether we are the same person over time, affecting moral responsibility
